intro: Erophila angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep root systems and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. It produces small, greenish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Erophila angustata is often found in sandy soils and is used in some traditional Indigenous practices.
